ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Lapping it up like female camels raging of thirst with disease."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: drinking it as thirsty camels do.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Drinking the way thirsty camels drink.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And you will drink (that) like Al-Him!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And drink as drinks the thirsty camel.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: lapping it down like thirsty camels.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Drinking even as the camel drinketh.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: You shall drink it as the thirsty camels drink."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Drinkers even as the drinking of thirsty camels.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Indeed ye shall drink like diseased camels raging with thirst!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: So you will drink (that) like thirsty camels!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: and you will drink as the lapping of thirsty camels.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And will drink as the drinking of thirsty camels.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [56:55] drinking like the drinking (read sharba or shurba: verbal noun) of thirsty camels’ (hīm is the plural of masculine haymān and feminine haymā, similar [in pattern] to ‘atshān, ‘atshā, ‘thirsty’).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: Drinking even as the camel drinketh) drinking even as a thirsty and sick camel do: it hardly gets filled; it is also said that this means: even as a thirsty camel drinks upon eating sour food.
